articleContent.title: Chord: 9th in F# (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: 9th in F# (Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation:
The 9th chord in F# with a shape based on the C chord provides a rich and colorful sound to music. This chord features a complex harmony and is often used to add depth and sophistication to chord progressions.

## Notes and Intervals:
- F# (Root)
- A# (Major 3rd)
- C# (Perfect 5th)
- E# (Major 7th)
- G# (Major 9th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor:
The 9th chord in F# with a shape based on C is commonly found in jazz, R&B, and soul music. It provides a jazzy and sophisticated flavor to compositions, creating a smooth and harmonically-rich sound. This chord adds a sense of color and tension, enhancing the overall musical experience.

## Songs:
1. **"So What" by Miles Davis:** This jazz classic features the 9th chord extensively, showcasing its versatility and harmonic richness.
   
2. **"Lovely Day" by Bill Withers:** This R&B/soul hit prominently uses the 9th chord in F# (based on C shape) to create a warm and soulful sound.
   
3. **"Spain" by Chick Corea:** This jazz fusion masterpiece includes the 9th chord in F# (based on C) to add depth and complexity to the composition.
